alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden; Gloucester; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:22PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Atlantic, southeastern Camden, east central Gloucester and southeastern Burlington Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Atsion to near Chesilhurst to near Glassboro. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glassboro, Hammonton, Pitman, Clayton, Egg Harbor City, Chesilhurst, Victory Lakes, Sicklerville, Wharton State Forest, Williamstown, Elwood-Magnolia, Atsion, Wading River, Bass River State Forest, Batsto, Monroe Township, New Gretna, Turnersville, Folsom and Collings Lakes. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 53 and 55. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 21 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
